raw: * Returns the data of the given type during the drop event
* on the drop target. This method fires a droprequest at
* the drag target which should be answered by calls to {@link #addData}.
* Note that this is a synchronous method and if any of the drag and drop
* events handlers are implemented using Promises, this may fail; @see
* @return {var} The result data in a promise

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the data of the given type during the drop event on the drop target. This method fires a droprequest at the drag target which should be answered by calls to {@link #addData}. Note that this is a synchronous method and if any of the drag and drop events handlers are implemented using Promises, this may fail; @see getDataAsync.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The result data in a promise
@return.description: The result data in a promise

raw: * Wrapper for {@link qx.event.Registration#fireEvent} for drag&drop events

* @param cancelable {Boolean} Whether the event is cancelable
* @return {qx.Promise|Boolean} true if the event's default behavior was

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Wrapper for {@link qx.event.Registration#fireEvent} for drag&drop events needed in this class.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
relatedTarget {Object} Related target, i.e. drag or drop target
    depending on the drag event
@param.description:
Related target, i.e. drag or drop target
    depending on the drag event

@param.name: @param
@param.body: cancelable {Boolean} Whether the event is cancelable

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {qx.Promise|Boolean} true if the event's default behavior was not prevented
@return.description: true if the event's default behavior was not prevented

raw: * Finds next draggable parent of the given element. Maybe the element itself as well.
* Looks for the attribute qxDraggable with the value on.
* @return {Element} The next parent element which is draggable. May also be null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds next draggable parent of the given element. Maybe the element itself as well. Looks for the attribute qxDraggable with the value on.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} The next parent element which is draggable. May also be null
@return.description: The next parent element which is draggable. May also be null

raw: * Finds next droppable parent of the given element. Maybe the element itself as well.
* Looks for the attribute qxDroppable with the value on.
* @return {Element} The next parent element which is droppable. May also be null

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds next droppable parent of the given element. Maybe the element itself as well. Looks for the attribute qxDroppable with the value on.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Element} The next parent element which is droppable. May also be null
@return.description: The next parent element which is droppable. May also be null

raw: * Helper to start the drag & drop session. It is responsible for firing the

* @return {Boolean} Returns false if drag session should be

@description.body: Helper to start the drag & drop session. It is responsible for firing the dragstart event and attaching the key listener.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Pointer} Either a longtap or pointermove event.
@param.description: Either a longtap or pointermove event.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns false if drag session should be canceled.
@return.description: Returns false if drag session should be canceled.

raw: * Helper function to compute the delta between current cursor position from given event
* @return {Map} containing the deltaX as x, and deltaY as y.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Helper function to compute the delta between current cursor position from given event and the stored coordinates at {@link #_onPointerdown}.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} containing the deltaX as x, and deltaY as y.
@return.description: containing the deltaX as x, and deltaY as y.
